frame.name: Suicide_attack
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Assailant</fen> attacks a <fen>Victim</fen>, intending to die in the process. In the prototypical case, the attack is designed to kill the <fen>Assailant</fen>, as when a pilot deliberately crashes a plane into the target.
<ex>The <fex name="Assailant">terrorist</fex> <t>suicide attack</t> <fex name="Victim">on U.S. troops</fex> <fex name="Time">early last week</fex> caused more damage than initially reported.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Assailant">They</fex> <t>kamikazed</t> <fex name="Victim">the base</fex> <fex name="Time">in the middle of the night</fex>!</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Victim
FE.definition:
<def-root>This <fen>Victim</fen> is the being or entity that is injured by the <fen>Assailant</fen>'s suicide attack.
<ex>Her <t>suicide attack</t> <fex name="Victim">on the guardsmen</fex> was the third such attack in the last month.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Weapon
FE.definition:
<def-root>An entity used by the <fen>Assailant</fen> to cause damage to the <fen>Victim</fen>.
<ex>The <t>suicide attack</t> <fex name="Wep">with a car</fex> killed over a dozen people.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Assailant
FE.definition:
<def-root>The person (or other self-directed entity) that is attempting physical harm to the <fen>Victim</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Assailant">The group's</fex> <t>suicide attacks</t> continue to affect troop morale.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Assailant</fen> that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). </def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>An intentional action performed by the <fen>Assailant</fen> that accomplishes the assault. </def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the place where the <fen>Assailant</fen> makes an assault on the <fen>Victim</fen>.
<ex>Last week's <t>suicide bombing</t> <fex name="Place">outside the city</fex> was the first in weeks.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the purpose for which an <fen>Assailant</fen> attacks the <fen>Victim</fen>.
<ex>They continue to <t>suicide-attack</t> throughout the city <fex name="Purp">to intimidate and terrorize the population</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the time when the <fen>Assailant</fen> attacks the <fen>Victim</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Time">Last Tuesday's</fex> <t>suicide attack</t> killed seven and wounded 20.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Source
FE.definition: <def-root>The starting-point of the motion of the <fen>Assailant</fen> or projectiles of the <fen>Assailant</fen> as they move toward the the <fen>Place</fen> that the <fen>Victim</fen> is occupying in the attack. In prepositional phrases, the prepositional object expresses the starting point of motion. With particles, the starting point of motion is understood from context.</def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE is used for any <fen>Depictive</fen> phrase describeing the state of the <fen>Assailant</fen> or <fen>Victim</fen> while the Attack occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Re-encoding
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE presents the current frame as an integral part of a larger conceptualization expressed by another frame. The frame expressed by the target typically corresponds to a Means action within the frame expressed by the <fex name="Re-encoding">Re-encoding</fex>, but not necessarily. </def-root>

FE.name: Result
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Result</fen> of the attack on the <fen>Victim</fen> by the <fen>Assailant</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Containing_event
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part.</def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases. </def-root>

FE.name: Particular_iteration
FE.definition: <def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. In addition, most expressions of Particular_iteration indicate which instance of the series is being referred to.</def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. </def-root>

FE.name: Path
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Path</fen> refers to (a part of) the ground over which the <fen>Assailant</fen> travels. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: suicide attack.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an attack which involves the death of the assailant.

lexUnit.name: suicide bombing.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an attack with an explosive in which the bomber kills him or herself.

lexUnit.name: kamikaze [attack].n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an attack in which a pilot crashes the airplane into the target.

lexUnit.name: suicide bomber.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an assailant who detonates a bomb, killing him- or herself and causing death or injury to those nearby.

lexUnit.name: suicide attacker.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person who attacks by employing a means that results in his or her own death.

lexUnit.name: kamikaze [person].n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a soldier (typically a pilot) who executes a suicide attack.
